newsitem.title: UK: First Marathon opposes Refuge/United deal.
newsitem.headline: First Marathon opposes Refuge/United deal.

text.p: First Marathon (U.K.) Ltd, the British unit of Canadian investment company First Marathon Inc, said on Wednesday it opposed the terms of the proposed merger between Refuge Group and United Friendly.
First Marathon detailed seven reasons why, as a Refuge shareholder, it was against the deal and also proposed terms that would be acceptable to it.

The proposed merger has caused controversy among Refuge shareholders and Perpetual, which owns seven percent of Refuge shares, has said it will vote against the deal at a special meeting convened for September 9.
Last week, Refuge and United Friendly executives met Refuge's biggest shareholder, Britannic Assurance, which owns just over 10 percent of the shares.
Britannic is expected to make up its mind on which way to vote this week.
In its statement, First Marathon said Refuge shareholders are disadvantaged as the terms attribute too high a share of the enlarged group to United Friendly shareholders.
It said the terms do not properly reflect financial considerations over and above embedded value and said the enlarged group should be equally split. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717.
